text: This remarkable man of medicine, whom Sir Francis Burdett described to Anglesey a or two later as 'more like a God upon earth than a human being', had an increasing number of disciples among unorthodox medical men in the cities of Europe. One of these was the Neapolitan, Dr Giuseppe Mauro, whom Anglesey consulted in May 1834.
